refnamediv.refpurpose: Creates a complex Task which can be used in PAsolve

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: The PATask object gives you more functionality when you call PAsolve than the basic function+parameters syntax. It allows you to:

listitem.para: chain executions of tasks, each task being dependant of the previous one inside the chain.
define a function for each task (vs a global function definition)
use custom source files which can contain the definition of library functions used by the main one.
add input and output files which will be transferred automatically to/from the workers.
reuse the result of the previous task inside the chain as an input parameter of the current task.
Number of lines of this PATask object
Number of columns of this PATask object
a string containing the name of thee function used by this task
A list containing the parameters of the function Func for this task
A string describing this task textually.
A list containing the full path of the source files used by the function Func.

A list containing the relative path (relative to this directory) of any input file used by the function Func. The files must be either located in the current directory or in a sub-directory, it is not possible to use files from a parent of sibling directory.

A list containing the relative path (relative to each distant Scilab session working directory) of any output file that will be created by the function Func. After the task is complete, the files will be transferred to the current directory accordingly to its relative path.

A string containing the path to a Selection Script which can be used to select nodes, in addition to the internal selection script which only selects machines which have been configured for Scilab use (see Installation). Refer to the Scheduler manual for a detailed explanation on how to write selection scripts.

A boolean which, if set to %t, tells that the first argument of the function Func will use the output of the previous PATask in the chain (previous line in the same column). The other parameters will be assigned by the "Params" list. For example, a function out=foo(a,b,c), called with Compose=%t and Params=list(1,2) will be evaluated foo(out_i,1,2) where out_i is the result of the previous PATask;

refsection.title: Examples
refsection.programlisting:
-->t=PATask(2,3);
-->t(1:2,1:3).Func='cosh';
-->t(2,1:3).Compose=%t;
-->t(1,1).Params=list(1);
-->t(1,2).Params=list(2);
-->t(1,3).Params=list(3);
